ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever smoked or used tobacco products for as long as one year?
Do (did) you usually smoke...? (choose primary method)
Notes: 1 = Cigarettes; 2 = Pipe; 3 = Cigars; 4 = Chewing Tobacco; 5 = Other

ElementDescription: Please specify your primary method of smoking
How many cigarettes do (did) you smoke each day, on average?
Age you started smoking?
What is your smoking status?
Notes: 1 = I have continued to smoke; 2 = I have given up smoking altogether, but less than 4 weeks; 3 = I have given up smoking altogether, but less than 3 months; 4 = I have given up smoking altogether, at least 3 months ago

ElementDescription: Age you stopped smoking?
Have you attempted to quit smoking in the past but failed?
Number of times attempted to quit.
Longest period of smoking cessation before relapse (months)
Longest period of smoking cessation before relapse (days)
Were (are) you regularly exposed to second-hand smoke in your home?
Were (are) you regularly exposed to second-hand smoke at your work?
Have you ever used an electronic cigarette or e-cigarette (also called vaping)?
Have you used an electronic cigarette in the past week?
